title: Product Header
reference-overview:
The Product Header consists of a combination of the following two components:.

  • Masthead
  • Navigation Bar

Each of these two components offers many different configurations. A few of the more common configurations are listed below.
reference-usage:
The Product Header should be used when it is important to provide a consistent main navigation option that is displayed on every screen, and when the number of main navigation options is manageble number (less than 7 or so).

There is an alternative option called the Toolbar Header that can be used when branding is less important.
reference-details:
• The two main pieces of the Product Header are the Masthead and the Navigation Bar. Click the name of each component to get more information.
  • The Product Header will span the entire width of the screen area, but the content area is contained within a 960px area centered on the screen.
reference-mobile:
The Product Header is responsive for mobile. Click into the details for each component to learn more:

  • Masthead
  • Navigation Bar
reference-example-description: This common configuration of the Product Header contains a Product Name and User Identifier in the Masthead. The tab version of the Navigation Bar is used, and it also uses a selection of icons tied to slide down menus.
reference-example-description-2: This version of the Product Header shows a Masthead with the User Identifier replaced with a company logo. The tab version of the Navigation Bar is used again, but this time without any supplemental icon navigation options.
reference-example-description-3: An optional Product Logo has been added to the Masthead in this configuration of the Product Header. The Masthead also contains the Product Name and the User Identifier control. The text version of the Navigation Bar is used here, along with the Menu icon on the left and a selection of additional Icons to the right of the text links.
reference-example-description-4: In this version of the Product Header, the Masthead contains both a Product Logo on the left and a Company Logo on the right. The User Identifier has been moved to the Navigation Bar, which uses the tabs version in this example.
